data.title: Fix Rectangle OuterRadius calculation
data.body:
It didn't take BottomLeft and TopRight corners into consideration, so it could end up too small depending on the positioning of the shape (see screenshots).

Additionally, this PR
- fixes the D2k repair pad footprint to match the original
- changes the `HitShape` debug overlay color from `Yellow` to `GreenYellow`, to avoid confusion with voxel render debug shapes
- adds debug overlays for `OuterRadius` to `Capsule` and `Rectangle` shapes
- adds debug overlay for `TargetablePositions`

The goal of this PR is to prevent the next revision of #13314 from growing too large.

Before:
![beforefix1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/26379895/cc66d4fe-401b-11e7-9e81-c897d311eed7.png)

After:
![afterfix1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/26379900/d2884016-401b-11e7-83e5-a72ebf6c8153.png)

data.title: Allow multiple terrain (tile) categories
data.body:
Allow multiple categories for tiles as requested here #13303 to display some tiles in more categories in Map editor.
At the beginning of each list by category are all tiles where first/main category is the selected one and then appended remaining tiles to the list so current order won't be affected.

data.title: Tooltip on build menu flickers when game is set to 'slow' speed.
data.body:
![sdfg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/26287492/0ffcf32e-3e7d-11e7-8644-888c72f60d51.jpg)

When moving the mouse slowly over the build menu the tooltip flickers. It happens only when the game is set to 'slow' speed.

data.title: [TS] Aircraft hover logic
data.body:
Currently, the aircraft in TS change their altitude through a full stop and hover up/down cycle depending on the elevation of the next tile. This is causing animation glitches and really weird behaviors in hilly maps. 

Instead of an on-the-spot hover up/down, I think a better method should be implemented like calculating an altitude curve which is easing depending on the target elevation and changes in between.

data.title: Colour changes when switching slot
data.body:
How to reproduce : 
1. Join a Server 
2. Change colour 
3. Switch slot

data.title: Add Cancel button to 'Connection Failed' dialog on host disconnect
data.body:
Adding 'Cancel' button to 'Connection Failed' dialog. For some reason ESC doesn't work here still. After Cancel click, dialog is closed and OpenRA reacts to next keys like ESC to open Options menu etc. It would be better to open Options menu on closing this dialog however.

On host disconnect, 'Connection Failed' dialog is displayed without a button, doesn't react to any key, OpenRA looks unresponsive. You need to find out you can click on Options button, otherwise players used to kill OpenRA process.

Now:
![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/26285473/e3c38a38-3e50-11e7-9c7a-4a7d8c7db25e.png)

Before (after clicking on Options button):
![obrazok](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16348750/26285477/ea3c32b6-3e50-11e7-863b-b8f961daea10.png)

This isn't the final solution as described here #12314. Is it better than current situation?

data.title: Stop LAN probe on close browser
data.body: The LAN probe wasn't disposed, stop it on closing browser.

data.title: Upgrade rules cannot update oramap files anymore
data.body: I didn't think of upgrade rules while testing #13223, they now error on oramaps with `Cannot update ZipFile without writable parent` (on Windows, in any case).

data.title: No clean exit possible on failed server connection
data.body:
Just after the end of a MP match yesterday (WIndows 10, 64 bit, release-20170421), the server connection failed while I was in the statistics menu. I could browse through all statistics, but not leave the game. I guess this was because the error message window blocked the "Close" button. I also tried "Escape" on the keyboard in vain. The only way out was to kill the programme in the task manager. Attaching replay and screenshot.
[OpenRA-2017-05-20T201912Z.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/1016914/OpenRA-2017-05-20T201912Z.zip)
![noexit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12261410/26283700/2e77a3b2-3e2d-11e7-93af-43ffbddc1e09.png)

data.title: Add Visualization chat commands
data.body:
New visualization chat commands - showcombatgeometry, showdebuggeometry, showdepthpreview, showactortags - available also for spectators.

Show Unit Paths (DevPathDebug chat command) is in Visualization section, but is also player command, so not available for spectators.
Were already available: terrainoverlay, debugcustomterrain.

To enable these 4 options in Debug window, World needs VisualizationMode trait. To enable also chat commands, World needs also VisualizationCommands trait.

Closes #13252

data.title: Right click to attack or capture building cursor stays green
data.body:
Something has happened in the latest update and I can now no longer right click to attack any enemy, capture buildings with engineers, etc

the cursor stays green all of the time except when I move it over mountains it will turn into the 'cannot' symbol. anyone else experiencing this? have uninstalled and reinstalled a dozen times, using Manjaro..... Tiberian Sun however still works fine, its only happening in RA....

data.title: Fix initial high ping - reported high latency on first connection to lobby
data.body:
Ideally the initial ping could be improved (or ignored?) as it takes much longer and it means after joining lobby, Latency can be displayed worse as actual, e.g. Yellow (rarely Red) first few seconds.

// ping history at 5 values (25 seconds)
-------------------------------------Before   After
Latency: -1, HistoryCount: 0	          ---      (Gray)	   (Gray)	
**Latency: 318, HistoryCount: 1**  ---      (Yellow)    **(Gray)**
Avg Latency: 180, HistoryCount: 2       ---      (Green)	   (Green)
Avg Latency: 146, HistoryCount: 3
Avg Latency: 131, HistoryCount: 4
Avg Latency: 120, HistoryCount: 5
Avg Latency: 70, HistoryCount: 5
Avg Latency: 68, HistoryCount: 5

These are numbers from Skirmish, not sure if it is the same or worse for multiplayer.
The later reported average latencies after first one 318 are still higher due to high first ping time.

data.body:
Open and close in game menu only on first key press.
Some other hotkeys also modified to apply them only on first key press.

Suggestion: change default ButtonWidget.OnKeyPress from { OnClick(); } to {ki => { if (ki.Event == KeyInputEvent.Down && !ki.IsRepeat) OnClick(); }

Closes #7941

data.title: Rare crash issue caused by AttackGarrisoned
data.body:
When the shooter and the transport is destroyed but the projectile is alive,

	public IEnumerable<T> TraitsImplementing<T>()
		{
			return World.TraitDict.WithInterface<T>(this);
		}

Firepower modifier computation tries read trait from the dead actor (transport).


data.title: Fix (Vehicle) pathing to next walled tile
data.body:
Fixes #6989

With 2 nearby cells and only 1 path between them, vehicle didn't move as starting graph points aren't closed and after expanding e.g. from the source cell to target cell, the path wasn't found. I don't know if there is better solution (e.g. should be source/target points Closed?), but this is at least simple/safe solution.
It could be also applied for FindUnitPathToRange function.

data.title: Player filter for blocks projectiles.
data.body: A tag that allows blocks projectiles to block bullets only if the firer of the bullet has certain stance (ally, enemy) with the onwer of the wall, could be cool to support some kind of cover system.

data.title: Surrender on Leave multiplayer game
data.body:
Fixes (partially) #13284.

When you Surrender, all your buildings/actors are destroyed and match could end if you are last player in your team. When you Leave, all is kept alive so the game can take longer or without a result as other team doesn't want to play anymore when all enemies already left. 
The leaving player now surrenders also on Leave.

I didn't find a clean way how to surrender on any disconnect as OrderManager is disposed and Surrender is resolved by MissionObjective trait.

data.title: Fix Map editor total ore money
data.body:
Fixes #13299

~On ore location with 500 amount (4 cells) correctly reported in Map editor, it was in game harvested more than its capacity, in this case 600 (1 value per unit per cell more).~

Map editor updated to conform harvesting.

data.title: Implement a workaround for the mono 5.0 cursor enumerator bug.
data.body:
Closes #13135.

My debugging suggests that the issue only happens when we have a `SelectMany().OrderBy()`, which we only use here and in a few places that do rendering (PBOG, Carryalls, editor actor previews).  I didn't notice any obvious issues with those, so I am reasonably confident based on the information at hand that we shouldn't have other more subtle (e.g. desync) bugs.

data.title: Cannot command harvester to harvest ore. OpenRA Red Alert 20170421, Mac OS 10.12.4
data.body:
In previous versions of OpenRA, I could command harvesters where to harvest ore. Now that option appears gone; I can command harvesters to a location, where they will sit idle, or I can command harvesters to a use a specific ore repository, but I cannot command them to harvest ore at a specified location.

Possibly related, I also used to be able to use the command button to force units to attack things that were not enemy units, which was useful for destroying items like bridges, but that option appears missing in this version of OpenRA.

data.title: Migrate projects to NET 4.5.2
data.body:
1. Migrate projects to NET 4.5.2
Starting January 12, 2016 Microsoft will no longer provide security updates, technical support or hotfixes for .NET 4, 4.5, and 4.5.1 frameworks.
After installation of VS 2017 on new computer, you can select between .net versions 3.5, 4.5.2, 4.6.1. Version 4.5 is not available and when opening OpenRA.sln, you are asked to either change it to 4.6.1 or keep it, but project is unloaded in such case. You can't install only 4.5.
By changing it to 4.6.1 automatically or manually lately to 4.5.2 works, but .csproj files are modified so conflict with git diff, rebase...

2. Remove unnecessary PostBuildEvent from D2k project
There is unnecessary (buggy) PostBuildEvent, which is not necessary, because the same action is done in AfterBuild event.

3. Use latest MSBuild by make.ps1 to use correct ToolsVersion 12.0 for Net 4.5.2
If I understand it correctly, MSBuild 4.6 ToolsVersion="4.0" is for .NET 4 projects, ToolsetVersion="12.0" for .net 4.5.1* projects. 
This update finds latest MSBuild, which understands .net 4.5.2 ToolsetVersion="12.0". Ps1 code adapted from https://pastebin.com/r5vGEP37.

data.title: Add HitShape trait
data.body:
...move Health.Shape there, add `ITargetablePositions`, and remove `ITargetablePositions` from `Building`.

This is the easier, uncontroversial part of #13196 and should *not* cause any regressions on bleed.

Closes #7717.
Closes #10349.

data.title: Fix map parameter warning as error from PR 13233
restarting a replay desyncs the replay
data.body:
I think this happens in bleed and I think it might have something  to do with recent PR:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13273
New random seed at the restart of the replay restart might be the cause of the desync.

I'm not 100% sure about this, I'm on my mod branch with cherry picked random seed fix mentioned above. My guess is the same thing will happen on current bleed too.
